definition: to evaluate the merit of sth
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: Nobel Literary Prize Down to Merit, Not Judges' Whim.
sentences.chinese: 诺贝尔文学奖论功封赏，非评判随心所欲。

sentences.english: You should reward them according to their deserts.
sentences.chinese: 你应该对他们论功行赏。

sentences.english: As a reward, I was promoted to district manager.
sentences.chinese: 论功行赏，我被升为大区经理。

sentences.english: The years of ineffectual service count big in the bestowal of rewards.
sentences.chinese: 几年徒劳无益的服务，在论功行赏时就大有关系。

sentences.english: The atmosphere doesn't award marks for effort.
sentences.chinese: 因为大气并不会论功行赏。

definition: to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
to join the nobility/to rise through the nobility
Grand Servant in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
high merit that one can never repay (idiom); invaluable achievements
the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
to report a heroic deed/to mention sb in dispatches
Great Ancestor (posthumous title, e.g. for the founder of a dynasty)
